videoData.title: Micro-power plants to bring electricity to millions
videoData.socialTitle: Micro-power plants to bring electricity to millions

nodes.whoTheyAre: Anil Raj is the Managing Director at OMC Power, a firm working to bring electricity to India’s rural villages by building micropower plants. A veteran of the telecom industry, Raj started India’s first mobile network in his role as the start-up CEO of Hutchinson Max Telecom in India. He later went on to Ericsson, where he held a number of senior management positions and established the company as a market leader in Indonesia and India.

videoData.description: Reliable electricity remains a distant dream for too many people around the world and simply linking to the existing grid can be cost prohibitive. In this talk, Anil Raj proposes an alternative: micropower plants, small-scale renewable energy sources connected to a minigrid.
videoData.socialDescription: Reliable electricity remains a distant dream for too many people around the world and simply linking to the existing grid can be cost prohibitive. In this talk, Anil Raj proposes an alternative: micropower plants, small-scale renewable energy sources connected to a minigrid.
